alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:57PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Judith Basin and south central Fergus Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hobson, or 16 miles west of Lewistown, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Hobson, Moore, Glengarry and Moccasin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Accumulating small sized hail can impact roadways and make driving difficult, use caution if hail accumulates onto roadways. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
